content: I'm sure most people can relate. What are your thoughts? _________________________________________________________________ Subject: I'm Tired, by Robert Hall I'm TiredI’ll be 63 soon. Except for one semester in college when jobs were scarce, and a six-month period when I was between jobs, but job-hunting every day, I’ve worked, hard, since I was 18. Despite some health challenges, I still put in 50-hour weeks, and haven’t called in sick in seven or eight years. I make a good salary, but I didn’t inherit my job or my income, and I worked to get where I am. Given the economy, there’s no retirement in sight, and I’m tired. Very tired. I’m tired of being told that I have to “spread the wealth around” to people who don’t have my work ethic. I’m tired of being told the government will take the money I earned, by force if necessary, and give it to people too lazy or stupid to earn it. I’m tired of being told that I have to pay more taxes to “keep people in their homes.” Sure, if they lost their jobs or got sick, I’m willing to help. But if they bought McMansions at three times the price of our paid-off, $250,000 condo, on one-third of my salary, then let the leftwing Congress critters who passed Fannie and Freddie and the Community Reinvestment Act that created the bubble help them—with their own money. I’m tired of being told how bad America is by leftwing millionaires like Michael Moore, George Soros and Hollywood entertainers who live in luxury because of the opportunities America offers. In thirty years, if they get their way, the United States will have the religious freedom and women’s rights of Saudi Arabia, the economy of Zimbabwe, the freedom of the press of China, the crime and violence of Mexico, the tolerance for Gay people of Iran, and the freedom of speech of Venezuela. Won’t multiculturalism be beautiful? I’m tired of being told that Islam is a “Religion of Peace,” when every day I can read dozens of stories of Muslim men killing their sisters, wives and daughters for their family “honor;” of Muslims rioting over some slight offense; of Muslims murdering Christian and Jews because they aren’t “believers;” of Muslims burning schools for girls; of Muslims stoning teenage rape victims to death for adultery;” of Muslims mutilating the genitals of little girls; all in the name of Allah, because the Qur’an and Shari’a law tells them to. I believe “a man should be judged by the content of his character, not by the color of his skin.” I’m tired of being told that “race doesn’t matter” in the post-racial world of President Obama, when it’s all that matters in affirmative action jobs, lower college admission and graduation standards for minorities (harming them the most), government contract set-asides, tolerance for the ghetto culture of violence and fatherless children that hurts minorities more than anyone, and in the appointment of US Senators from Illinois. I think it’s very cool that we have a black president and that a black child is doing her homework at the desk where Lincoln wrote the emancipation proclamation. I just wish the black president was Condi Rice, or someone who believes more in freedom and the individual and less in an all-knowing government. I’m tired of a news media that thinks Bush’s fundraising and inaugural expenses were obscene, but that think Obama’s, at triple the cost, were wonderful. That thinks Bush exercising daily was a waste of presidential time, but Obama exercising is a great example for the public to control weight and stress, that picked over every line of Bush’s military records, but never demanded that Kerry release his, that slammed Palin with two years as governor for being too inexperienced for VP, but touted Obama with three years as senator as potentially the best president ever. Wonder why people are dropping their subscriptions or switching to Fox News? Get a clue. I didn’t vote for Bush in 2000, but the media and Kerry drove me to his camp in 2004. I’m tired of being told that out of “tolerance for other cultures” we must let Saudi Arabia use our oil money to fund mosques and madrassa Islamic schools to preach hate in America, while no American group is allowed to fund a church, synagogue or religious school in Saudi Arabia to teach love and tolerance. I’m tired of being told I must lower my living standard to fight global warming, which no one is allowed to debate. My wife and I live in a two-bedroom apartment and carpool together five miles to our jobs. We also own a three-bedroom condo where our daughter and granddaughter live. Our carbon footprint is about 5% of Al Gore’s, and if you’re greener than Gore, you’re green enough. I’m tired of being told that drug addicts have a disease, and I must help support and treat them, and pay for the damage they do. Did a giant germ rush out of a dark alley, grab them, and stuff white powder up their noses while they tried to fight it off? I don’t think Gay people choose to be Gay, but I damn sure think druggies chose to take drugs. And I’m tired of harassment from cool people treating me like a freak when I tell them I never tried marijuana. I’m tired of illegal aliens being called “undocumented workers,” especially the ones who aren’t working, but are living on welfare or crime. What’s next? Calling drug dealers, “Undocumented Pharmacists”? And, no, I’m not against Hispanics. Most of them are Catholic and it’s been a few hundred years since Catholics wanted to kill me for my religion. I’m willing to fast track for citizenship any Hispanic person who can speak English, doesn’t have a criminal record and who is self-supporting without family on welfare, or who serves honorably for three years in our military. Those are the citizens we need. I’m tired of latte liberals and journalists, who would never wear the uniform of the Republic themselves, or let their entitlement-handicapped kids near a recruiting station, trashing our military. They and their kids can sit at home, never having to make split-second decisions under life and death circumstances, and bad mouth better people then themselves. Do bad things happen in war? You bet. Do our troops sometimes misbehave? Sure. Does this compare with the atrocities that were the policy of our enemies for the last fifty years—and still are? Not even close. So here’s the deal. I’ll let myself be subjected to all the humiliation and abuse that was heaped on terrorists at Abu Ghraib or Gitmo, and the critics can let themselves be subject to captivity by the Muslims who tortured and beheaded Daniel Pearl in Pakistan, or the Muslims who tortured and murdered Marine Lt. Col. William Higgins in Lebanon, or the Muslims who ran the blood-spattered Al Qaeda torture rooms our troops found in Iraq, or the Muslims who cut off the heads of schoolgirls in Indonesia, because the girls were Christian. Then we’ll compare notes. British and American soldiers are the only troops in history that civilians came to for help and handouts, instead of hiding from in fear. I’m tired of people telling me that their party has a corner on virtue and the other party has a corner on corruption. Read the papers—bums are bi-partisan. And I’m tired of people telling me we need bi-partisanship. I live in Illinois, where the “Illinois Combine” of Democrats and Republicans has worked together harmoniously to loot the public for years. And I notice that the tax cheats in Obama’s cabinet are bi-partisan as well. I’m tired of hearing wealthy athletes, entertainers and politicians of both parties talking about innocent mistakes, stupid mistakes or youthful mistakes, when we all know they think their only mistake was getting caught. I’m tired of people with a sense of entitlement, rich or poor. Speaking of poor, I’m tired of hearing people with air-conditioned homes, color TVs and two cars called poor. The majority of Americans didn’t have that in 1970, but we didn’t know we were “poor.” The poverty pimps have to keep changing the definition of poor to keep the dollars flowing. I’m real tired of people who don’t take responsibility for their lives and actions. I’m tired of hearing them blame the government, or discrimination, or big-whatever for their problems. Yes, I’m damn tired. But I’m also glad to be 63. Because, mostly, I’m not going to get to see the world these people are making. I’m just sorry for my granddaughter. Robert A. Hall is a Marine Vietnam veteran who served five terms in the Massachusetts state senate. He blogs at tartanmarine. ___________________________________

title: I'm Tired, by Robert Hall

Hall is a Marine Vietnam veteran who served five terms in the Massachusetts state senate. He blogs at tartanmarine. ___________________________________ I'm tired of my money going to useless pork, like a modern rail system I'm tired of my money being spent on Police and Firemen, when I own both a gun and a hose. I'm tired of my money being spent to educate children. Let the parents pay. I'm tired of my money being spent on pork projects to maintain an infrastructure. I'm tired of my money being spent to keep banks functioning (except my bank of course - Let's keep our eye on the eightball here) I'm tired of subsidies to mass transit - What's wrong with walking? I'm tired of Christian terrorists who defacto have made abortion illegal in most states by bombing abortion clinics and killing doctors. I'm tired of hearing about useless parasites who pull down millions while they run their companies into the ground, and their hard working employees starve. But most of all I'm tired of living in a modern country, and thanks be, that if the author of this essay had his way, we would all be living in wonderful caves, eating the neighbors for our daily meat. And actually I'm tired of all these useless sterotypes presented as Fact. If you can find one person who cheats to get food stamps, that proves that the other thirty million people are also cheating - I have to pause and give special note to the following statement - It simply turns me on so much... quote: I’m tired of being told that out of “tolerance for other cultures” we must let Saudi Arabia use our oil money to fund mosques and madrassa Islamic schools to preach hate in America, while no American group is allowed to fund a church, synagogue or religious school in Saudi Arabia to teach love and tolerance. Must be leftists who support the Saudi's... Dave

Then we’ll compare notes. British and American soldiers are the only troops in history that civilians came to for help and handouts, instead of hiding from in fear. I’m tired of people telling me that their party has a corner on virtue and the other party has a corner on corruption. Read the papers—bums are bi-partisan. And I’m tired of people telling me we need bi-partisanship. I live in Illinois, where the “Illinois Combine” of Democrats and Republicans has worked together harmoniously to loot the public for years. And I notice that the tax cheats in Obama’s cabinet are bi-partisan as well. I’m tired of hearing wealthy athletes, entertainers and politicians of both parties talking about innocent mistakes, stupid mistakes or youthful mistakes, when we all know they think their only mistake was getting caught. I’m tired of people with a sense of entitlement, rich or poor. Speaking of poor, I’m tired of hearing people with air-conditioned homes, color TVs and two cars called poor. The majority of Americans didn’t have that in 1970, but we didn’t know we were “poor.” The poverty pimps have to keep changing the definition of poor to keep the dollars flowing. I’m real tired of people who don’t take responsibility for their lives and actions. I’m tired of hearing them blame the government, or discrimination, or big-whatever for their problems. Yes, I’m damn tired. But I’m also glad to be 63. Because, mostly, I’m not going to get to see the world these people are making. I’m just sorry for my granddaughter. Robert A. Hall is a Marine Vietnam veteran who served five terms in the Massachusetts state senate. He blogs at tartanmarine. ___________________________________
reply: I'm tired of my money going to useless pork, like a modern rail system I'm tired of my money being spent on Police and Firemen, when I own both a gun and a hose. I'm tired of my money being spent to educate children. Let the parents pay. I'm tired of my money being spent on pork projects to maintain an infrastructure. I'm tired of my money being spent to keep banks functioning (except my bank of course - Let's keep our eye on the eightball here) I'm tired of subsidies to mass transit - What's wrong with walking? I'm tired of Christian terrorists who defacto have made abortion illegal in most states by bombing abortion clinics and killing doctors. I'm tired of hearing about useless parasites who pull down millions while they run their companies into the ground, and their hard working employees starve. But most of all I'm tired of living in a modern country, and thanks be, that if the author of this essay had his way, we would all be living in wonderful caves, eating the neighbors for our daily meat. And actually I'm tired of all these useless sterotypes presented as Fact. If you can find one person who cheats to get food stamps, that proves that the other thirty million people are also cheating - I have to pause and give special note to the following statement - It simply turns me on so much... quote: I’m tired of being told that out of “tolerance for other cultures” we must let Saudi Arabia use our oil money to fund mosques and madrassa Islamic schools to preach hate in America, while no American group is allowed to fund a church, synagogue or religious school in Saudi Arabia to teach love and tolerance. Must be leftists who support the Saudi's... Dave
title: I'm Tired, by Robert Hall

content: Good response, Dave! I couldn't have said it as well. Frank

content: quote: I'm sure most people can relate. What are your thoughts? I'm way too tired to read this thing. Just too long! When Moses went up on the mountain for a list of God's laws it only had 10 things on it.
quote: I'm sure most people can relate. What are your thoughts?
reply: I'm way too tired to read this thing. Just too long! When Moses went up on the mountain for a list of God's laws it only had 10 things on it.
title: I'm Tired, by Robert Hall

content: I totally agree with a lot of what you've written There are, however, some things you've stated that I don't agree with. "I'm tired of my money going to useless pork, like a modern rail system" A modern rail system would decrease fossil fuel use and the associated emissions. Fewer American dollars would go to Arab oil producing nations. Americans would benefit with lower transportation costs as well as lower priced goods. I'm tired of my money being spent on Police and Firemen, when I own both a gun and a hose. I don't know in what vein you're writing this but without trained police there would be total chaos. Sure you have a gun, I have a gun too. As a matter of fact I have a whole crowd of guns. They do us little or no good at all. Think about it. Are you going to be up and alert 24/7 to protect yourself? Are you going to go with your wife wherever she goes? Are you able to do all that and also go with your children wherever they go? Are you able to keep drunks off the road and pedophiles away from your kid's school? How about the same question about everyone else. I've been handling guns and shooting in competition most of my life and I'm darn good at it. I'll be happy to concede that the same applies to you. What about the guy that doesn't have a gun? What about the guy that shouldn't have a gun because he'd more of a danger to himself and those around him than the crook? I believe if you think it through, you'll realize we need police. As far as the fire department goes, trust me, we need them too. Have you ever had a house fire? I have and it's often not something one can put out with a garden hose. When our house burned we didn't even know we were afire till some of the lights went out. Even then we figured it was just a popped circuit breaker. It wasn't till I went to the part of the house where the breaker panel was that I smelled the smoke and realized what was happening. Ten garden hoses would have put that fire out. there were three pumpers there and they were open for business. Even so we saved very little. I think that you also need to consider the contributions to fire prevention and education fire departments provide. I'm tired of my money being spent to educate children. Let the parents pay. A well educated populous helps all of us. They're less likely to end up on the welfare rolls; they earn more money and pay more taxes. I'm tired of my money being spent on pork projects to maintain an infrastructure. I'm tired of my money being spent to keep banks functioning (except my bank of course - Let's keep our eye on the eightball here) Uh-huh I'm tired of subsidies to mass transit - What's wrong with walking? Let's suppose you live twenty miles from where you work. Would you like to walk 40 miles five days a week and how long would it take? Mass transit is good in a number of ways. It offers people who might not be able to afford their own car options like where to work or shop. Mass transit reduces harmful emissions. Mass transit reduces gridlock on our highways. I was raised in a area that had great mass transit. I always owned a car but rarely drove it. Most of the places I went to were accessible by bus and or subway and I never had to look for a place to park. On the rare occasions that the bus or subway didn't go to where I needed to go I'd drive myself. I'm tired of Christian terrorists who defacto have made abortion illegal in most states by bombing abortion clinics and killing doctors. I am too! I'm tired of hearing about useless parasites who pull down millions while they run their companies into the ground, and their hard working employees starve. You got that right! But most of all I'm tired of living in a modern country, and thanks be, that if the author of this essay had his way, we would all be living in wonderful caves, eating the neighbors for our daily meat. Big Grin And actually I'm tired of all these useless sterotypes presented as Fact. If you can find one person who cheats to get food stamps, that proves that the other thirty million people are also cheating [/quote] I must disagree with you here. How can you vilify everyone that gets food stamps or any other assistance because a small number cheat? I think you need to rethink that one. How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?

title: I'm Tired, by Robert Hall

content: I'm tired of big government,that shows no respect to the states or the citzens which it should be serving. I'm tired of helmet laws, seatbelt laws, national speed limits, and black garbed police who don't know what street their warrent was obtained for. I'm tired of judges who impose light sentences for dangerous criminals, and I'm tired of paying for the crime schools they call prisons.

title: I'm Tired, by Robert Hall

content: There's no need to worry, sailorsmom. You are in the Right and righteous path. I also think the way you do. Nobody can outdo our work ethics. I work 14-16 hours a day. And by doing so I was able to save money to buy a house though I am still reserving it while renting an apartment. I do not whine in the workplace. If I get fired, I say, there's jobs out there. I thank my employer for having hired me. I believe in democratic capitalism unlike Moore and Obama. I detest congressmen supporting Cuba mmaterially while 'pretending to support the Cuban embargo'. The Lord God knows the 'numbers of our hair' and He rewards your righteousness annd righteousness of the Right (Read Ann Coulter's books)And here's a revelation worth keeping in everybody's chest: It was not the Right who had me fired but it was the communists inspite of a job well done. This message has been edited. Last edited by: kipfer, Mon 20 April 2009 06:16 AM

title: I'm Tired, by Robert Hall

content: I'm tired of know nothings blaming the economic meltdown on too many regulations. I'm tired of people who call the the government "communist" because it runs the post office. I'm tired blaming illegal immirgrants for the problem of illegal immigration, while the guys who hire them are given a bye. I'm tired of unions being blamed for outsourcing, when anyone who can add two plus two, knows that no American can compete with someone being paid a dollar a day. I'm tired of hearing that making the minimum wage a living wage will destroy the American economy, as if paying 28K a year for honest work is evil. I'm tired of a society which calls paying 15 billion a year in food stamps welfare (because people aren't being paid a living wage) but applaud hundreds of billions of tax breaks, as "incentive." I'm tired of people who want to illegally eliminate one part of the Constitution as sensible, while calling their opposite isomars who want to eliminate another, as criminals (take your pick - if you defend the Second, you're a Fascist, it you defend the Fourth, you love Al Qaeda). I'm tired of of crazed conspiricy theories about Bush taking down the WTC or Obama being a secret Muslim born in Kenya. I'm tired of anyone who calls their political opponents traitors. I'm tired of people who call an election fair, if their side won, and it was stolen if they lost. I'm tired of credit card companies that can legally jack up your interest anytime they please, making mafia loan sharks look like honest men. Dave

title: I'm Tired, by Robert Hall

content: I am equally tired of agents of influence in the House of Representatives or congressmen who vocally support Cuban embargo but have supported pieces of legislation that benefit Cuba materially (sending dollars to Cuba), economically, politically, etc. I am tired of a Liberal candidate president whose wife is baglady for the Left anddother subversive organizations, etc. I am tired of a Democrat ex-president who scandalized the whole countr by putting a cigar on theh '*****[ of an intern which I can forgive because I have my own perversions but cannot for selling out the Elian Gonzales case in favoour of his handlers in Cuba andn Fidel. I am tired of a Democrat who wants to propagate universal health care all over the world but not democracy in Iraq, Cuba and AFghanistan.
